response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (20 years old)", "high", "Being very young is associated with a higher likelihood of engaging in criminal activities and recidivism."),
    ("Gender (male)", "high", "Males statistically have higher recidivism rates."),
    ("Ethnicity (Hispanic)", "medium", "While ethnicity itself is not a strong predictor, social and economic factors associated with minority status may contribute to risk."),
    ("Prior Arrest (1 arrest, not convicted)", "medium", "A history of an arrest, even without conviction, indicates some involvement with law enforcement and potential behavioral risk."),
    ("Education (GED, not enrolled in college)", "medium", "Lower formal education levels can be correlated with reduced opportunities, which may increase recidivism risk."),
    ("Employment (4 jobs held during the year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes may indicate instability in employment, affecting socioeconomic stability and increasing risk."),
    ("Substance Use (marijuana and cocaine use in past four years)", "high", "Active drug use, especially including cocaine, is strongly linked to higher recidivism rates."),
    ("Mental Health (feeling down sometimes recently)", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms can be associated with unstable behavior and increased risk, though not definitive on its own."),
    ("Family Background (lived with biological mother in a household of 5 in urban area)", "medium", "Urban upbringing and larger household sizes can reflect diverse social exposures, which may contribute to risk."),
    ("Religious Belief (considers God influential)", "low", "A belief in higher power can sometimes provide a protective effect, offering structure and moral guidance.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being very young is associated with a higher likelihood of engaging in criminal activities and recidivism.
Males statistically have higher recidivism rates.
While ethnicity itself is not a strong predictor, social and economic factors associated with minority status may contribute to risk.
A history of an arrest, even without conviction, indicates some involvement with law enforcement and potential behavioral risk.
Lower formal education levels can be correlated with reduced opportunities, which may increase recidivism risk.
Employment (4 jobs held during the year)
Frequent job changes may indicate instability in employment, affecting socioeconomic stability and increasing risk.
Substance Use (marijuana and cocaine use in past four years)
Active drug use, especially including cocaine, is strongly linked to higher recidivism rates.
Experiencing depressive symptoms can be associated with unstable behavior and increased risk, though not definitive on its own.
Family Background (lived with biological mother in a household of 5 in urban area)
Urban upbringing and larger household sizes can reflect diverse social exposures, which may contribute to risk.
A belief in higher power can sometimes provide a protective effect, offering structure and moral guidance.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 2 inches and weighs 215 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 4 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
